_header: My name is parrot a bird of paradise
Subjects: birds, as narrators; envoys; political poems; satire
_description: ‘Speke, parott’, by John Skelton — 511 lines chiefly in rhyme royal stanzas, and with repeated envoys

BLHar2252.First Lines:
My name ys parott A Byrde of paradyseBy nature devysed of a
                    wonderowus kynde…
BLHar2252.Last Lines:
…Such pollaxis & pillers such mvlys trapte with goldSens
                    dewcalyons flodde in no cronycle ys told
BLHar2252.Editions:
Dyce,  Alexander,
                        ed.  
             The Poetical Works of John Skelton.
         2 vols. London: T. Rodd, 1843: 1.1-25.
